profile.name: Zoran Angelovski
profile.title: Senior Consultant / Project Manager
profile.bio:
I have spent 25+ years in development environments starting off with getting my hands dirty in hardware then moving to system level design in the telco space.  More recently I have project managed the development and deployment of electric vehicle chargers, smart energy gadgets and IoT systems. 

Throughout my career I have been involved in some wild rides and technology waves.  I have worked with startups from the U.S. and lead a local tech team to implement what has turned out to be core products for broadband systems in Australia, followed by project managing the development of products for big picture initiatives like the NBN.  The current wave I am enjoying is working on Smart Energy and IoT products and systems with our DiUS start up Percepscion.
profile.passion: As with many of our DiUS people I am firstly a family person. Tragically I am a Richmond FC supporter and still believe! When I can I like to get out to places where fewer people visit, nothing extreme just fantastically stunning places like our high country, beaches and rivers.   After taking it up about 10 years ago I am still an amateur snowboarder and enjoy the scenery enough to give it another go.

experiences.place: State Government of Victoria Department of Environment & Primary Industries
experiences.description: The “Air Quality” (AirQ) project under this program developed and trialled a proof of concept pervasive environmental sensing platform. The projects aim was to provide real time air quality information to the public through a broadband connection to a computer, tablet and smart phone. My role involved managing the internal development, sensor deployment and stakeholder management of key partners DEPI and EPA Victoria.
experiences.subtitle: Broadband – Enabled Innovation Program (BEIP) Air Quality Monitoring

experiences.description: SP AusNet is a power distribution company delivering electricity to nearly 1 million homes in Victoria.  SP AusNet contracted DiUS to develop an ESI on a significant portion of their network .  The ESI enables consumers to make use of the meters Smart Energy capabilities.  My role in this project was to manage the development and coordinate with SP AusNet and U.S. supplier of their metering infrastructure.
experiences.subtitle: Smart Meter - Energy Services Interface (ESI)

profile.name: Amir Ansari
profile.title: Head of User Experience
profile.bio: If there’s one theme that’s defined my career, it’s making technology easy to use. I’ve spent a considerable amount of time working with research laboratories and user experience consultancies to understand what innovations are coming and how we can make them human-friendly. I’ve also added consulting and project management skills to my portfolio which enable me to meet the needs of all stakeholders.
profile.passion:
“I’m excited by technology that fits seamlessly into the way humans live and work – too often technology comes first and then has to be retrofitted for our use.”

At work I’m known as ‘the scooter guy’ – I travel everywhere on one! As a technology that’s optimised for the user experience, it’s hard to beat.

experiences.description:
I’m head of user experience at DiUS; over the last 14 years I’ve designed intranets, mobile applications, web applications and websites, all with a strong focus on usability and utility. I’m also responsible for our in-house user experience capabilities, making sure the team’s expertise is always growing.

I’ve used my investigative, creative and problem-solving skills to deliver rich user experiences that meet client project goals. My achievements on individual projects range from generating business requirements to providing post-completion quality assurance.

My approach to completing projects is pragmatic. This helps our team work around obstacles with a minimum of fuss and without compromising timelines or objectives.

Ultimately, I aim to innovate and provide great experiences in any medium while bringing value to our customers. I discuss this and other topics in the DiUS blog – including entries on [user experience strategy]( http://dius.com.au/2014/05/29/top-10-1-tips-creating-successful-experience-strategy/)  and [flat design](http://dius.com.au/2013/11/29/to-flat-design-or-not-to-flat-design/).

User Experience Strategy and Mobile Application

This project involved designing the next version of the bank’s iPhone application and developing a long-term customer experience strategy. My contributions included working with the client user experience expert on design direction and vision; undertaking usability testing of prototypes and providing recommendations to the design team; and providing input into the bank’s customer experience strategy pack.
experiences.subtitle: January - March 2014

experiences.description:
Customer Relationship Management Mobile Application

Pronto Software was looking to deliver the next version of its Customer 
Relationship Management mobile application. The project involved providing best-practice design guidelines and principles, and making design recommendations for the application. As lead user experience designer, I helped generate business requirements, managed stakeholders, established design principles, undertook persona generation, conducted an expert review and made recommendations to improve the design.
experiences.subtitle: December 2013

educations.description: Bachelor of Industrial Design (First class honours)

education_and_trainings.description: Bachelor of Industrial Design (First class honours)

profile.name: Erik Danielsen
profile.title: Senior Software Engineer
profile.bio: I like to think that I am a systems thinker, I need to see and understand the big picture with everything I do but I also like to get stuck into the details and am a stickler for quality on every level. I believe there has to be a balance between agility and up-front thinking and design, we sometimes forget that when we work in an agile environment where the focus is on individual stories. I enjoy mentoring others to build good software when I'm not too busy engineering systems myself - I can see myself as a teacher one day!
profile.passion:
Consulting is the only job I had since graduating (apart from a 1 year stint as associate lecturer at La Trobe University) and I love it. I love having different problems thrown at me from different businesses and helping them to come up with a solution.

When I am not working I am mostly spending time with my family, ideally somewhere outdoors. I love nature, humans haven't made anything that can compete with the wonders of nature

experiences.description: Helped REA Group in their transition from big legacy applications towards micro services as a senior developer and tech lead. Also helped mentor a newly formed team to understand what is required to make a new system production ready
experiences.subtitle: September 2012 - June 2014

experiences.description: Helped Sensis upgrade the mobile version of Whitepages Online for a greatly improved user experience. The whitepages mobile site went on to win the "Best mobile enable website" award at the 2011 Australian Mobile Awards
experiences.subtitle: January 2011 - June 2011

experiences.description: Australia Post needed a system to manage mail sorting plans (effectively delivery routes for posties) automatically and push them out to their sorting machines nightly for sorting overnight. This is the most fun project I've worked on because of the effect it had on the physical world. If we got it wrong, we would have had to answer to some very angry posties... Our final test was to run 250,000 letters through a sorting machines and make sure they came out in the correct order - which they did!
experiences.subtitle: July 2009 - December 2009

profile.name: Alex Serdyuk
profile.title: Software Engineer
profile.bio: Software developer with sound industry experience in Software Development, Testing and Support. He is hardworking, self-motivated, enthusiastic, extremely energetic, friendly individual with the ability to adapt to new and changing environments.
profile.passion:
* Ruby programming language and Rails web framework.  
* Emerging front-end technologies such us CoffeeScript, AngularJS and Box2D.   
* Back-end tools such as PostgreSQL and Redis.  
* Agile delivery process.

experiences.description: InfoMedix was formed to deliver products and services for information integration in the healthcare industry. InfoMedix has now been involved for number of years in the development of the Clinical Patient Folder (CPF) system for the management and processing of a Scanned Medical Record.  Role core product development as well as integration with external system via Hl7 protocol.
experiences.subtitle: 4 years

experiences.description: Jedo is a social media and digital marketing platform.  It provides event organizers with the ability to easily list their events and promotes those events once they are published.  For the user the platform offers the ability to search for, obtain information and book into relevant events.  The role involved rapid application development using Ruby on Rails and JavaScript in a pure start up environment.
experiences.subtitle: 1 year

experiences.description: ‘Ideas to action’ is a mobile app focusing on placing the ideas worth spreading within the TEDx community into action.  The application has has the Ruby on Rails backend and JavaScript (AngularJS) frontend.  It is available for iOS and Adroid.  The role involved application design and development.
experiences.subtitle: 3 month

experiences.description: realestateview.com.au is the third largest real estate classifieds web site in Australia.  The project involved helping REIV with the improvements to their processes and operations.  Role responsibilities included creating automated test suit, consolidating code from various third party vendors under in-house source control system, automating server provisioning, production environment migrations.
experiences.subtitle: 3 month

experiences.description: Open Food Network (OFN) – a free, open source, scalable e-commerce marketplace and logistics platform that enables communities and producers to connect, trade and co-ordinate movement of food. It’s like a network of online farmers markets that enables everyone to participate. Through peer-to-peer product traceability and transparency, it helps put control over food into the hands of farmers, eaters and local enterprises.  The role involved rapid development of large feature set in very limited timeframe.
experiences.subtitle: 3 weeks

experiences.description: Wilberforce is the freight management system that makes it easy do service, dispatch and track freight.  The role involved UI development as well as preparation for the first production release.
experiences.subtitle: 2 month

experiences.description: The project scope included consolidating two university applications (iTeach and iLearn) into a single monolithic application, improving usability/UI look and feel of the application as well as additional integration with other university systems.  The role included remote web application development working with the core Sydney-based team.  The responsibilities included integration with other university systems via XML feed, refactoring legacy code base, modernizing user interface and increasing test coverage.
experiences.subtitle: 3 month

educations.description: Bachelor of Computer Science and Software Engineering

education_and_trainings.description: Bachelor of Computer Science and Software Engineering

profile.name: Bethany Skurrie
profile.title: Software developer
profile.bio: Bethany is committed to developing systems of the highest quality.  While development is her primary focus, she enjoys working closely with BAs and clients in design, making use of her excellent communication skills.  While starting her career with a UI focus, she now enjoys the challenges of backend application and API development, using Ruby as her preferred language.  She has a strong OO design background.
profile.passion:
Making useful things. 
Working on the "Pact" library.

experiences.description: REA is in the process of transitioning its architecture from “monolithic” applications to microservices. I worked on multiple projects that used microservices to integrate various third party applications by creating stable APIs and "synching" services. As the microservices approach is still relatively new, it has been a learning experience for all involved, and one I have enjoyed. My major contribution to the work was my development on the "Pact" library, which uses Consumer Driven Contracts to replace traditional integration tests.
experiences.subtitle: June 2013 – Present

experiences.description: As the technical lead for the offshore web development team, I was responsible for managing the code quality of the team, as well as providing them with Javascript APIs to access the backend service, which was developed by a separate team in another country. My role morphed from being purely technical to one where, as the middleman between the systems and teams, I performed a lot of gap analysis on the UI design and the backend system capabilities. While it was the most challenging role I have undertaken, I enjoyed being able to use a wide variety of skills that stretched my brain.
experiences.subtitle: July 2012 – May 2013

experiences.description: The AMI Customer Portal allows Jemena customers to track and visualise their electricity consumption. I worked on creating graphs that allowed customers to visualise their energy usage and generation over different time periods, and to view their changes in cost and consumption between periods. Though the library we used, Highcharts, was very customisable, it was a challenge nonetheless to turn the designers beautiful mockups into reality, but one I think we did successfully. It made me appreciate the difficulty of turning raw numbers into information that the human brain can process meaningfully.
experiences.subtitle: August 2011 – June 2012

profile.name: Voon Wong
profile.title: Software Engineer
profile.bio:
Voon started his career lecturing undergraduate signal processing and communication theory, before venturing into the niche field of waveform design for satellite radio communications, where he developed a number of military and civilian applications.

Beginning with embedded software, over time Voon has amassed a deep stack experience; from pushing/popping registers in the CPU to distributed machine learning of Big Data, and from backend development (eg. Grails, Rails, Node.js) to front-end development (eg, Angular.js).

He is also passionate about getting things done efficiently through Agile principles: reducing errors through automation, and minimising waste through lightweight processes.
profile.passion: Outside of work, Voon keenly studies philosophy and psychology, trying to understand the human mind - it's much harder than trying to understand a machine!  He is also a Level 2 latin and ballroom dance instructor.

experiences.description:
Developed in a team, a web-app for managing consignments and despatches for a freight broker, using Rails and Angular.js.  A large portion of this work involved integration with customers as well as transport carriers.

Also, designed a machine-learning algorithm in Python to provide a prediction of expected delivery time based on a carrier's past performance.
experiences.subtitle: First half 2014

experiences.description: Performed Big-Data analysis of user behaviour to predict user churn (unsubscribing), so that mitigation can be performed; computation is performed in Python.
experiences.subtitle: Late 2013

experiences.description: Primary developer for a Grails web-service for storage and retrieval of large amounts of time series data backed with Hadoop.  This was done before AWS offered MapReduce capabilities, so there is a lot of work with provisioning scalable virtual machines to support Hadoop as part of this effort.

Programmed custom-made ZigBee capable In-Home-Devices as part of Victoria's Smart Meter program.  A significant part of this work involves ensuring that the device is standards compliant, and can interoperate with other manufacturers' devices.
Designed Forward Error Correction algorithms for a dual-mode terrestrial (GSM) and satellite (GMR2+) phone capable of operating anywhere in the world.
Designed a new multi-user receiver that improved capacity 20-fold for tracking of military assets in the field.

educations.description: Bachelor of Engineering (Computer Systems Engineering), 1st Class Honours

education_and_trainings.description: Bachelor of Engineering (Computer Systems Engineering), 1st Class Honours

profile.name: Leanne Tilmanis
profile.title: User Experience Consultant
profile.bio: I'm a passionate user advocate and I aim to create experiences that match the users' mental model and fades the technology into the background. I started my career in social research where I worked in psychology and behavioural-change projects using both quantitative and qualitative methods. Since then I have gained over 10 years experience in research, statistical analysis and user centre design teaching at postgraduate level.
profile.passion:
I have a passion for psychology, research, teaching and technology. I regularly attend UX book clubs and industry nights and I look for opportunities to give back to the community. 

I spend my weekends renovating my house and hanging out at farmers markets.

experiences.description:
For this client we helped evaluate the usability of its on-line product application forms. We conducted usability testing with current and prospective customers and delivered prioritised descriptions of potential usability issues and clear recommendations. The ME Bank project team now has the ability to improve the forms' usability, which could, in turn, increase conversion.

Key contributions include: setting up research approach; conducting usability testing with 12 participants; documenting findings and recommendations; and creating video clips of user interactions to help the project team gain traction for implementing changes to the existing forms.
experiences.subtitle: April 2014

experiences.description: This role involved the development of a web-based self-management application for people with arthritis and depression. I was in charge of interaction design and usability testing, to ensure the system was usable for an aging and non-savvy audience. My other responsibilities were to: liaise between stakeholders and potential web contractors; prepare the requirements analysis and design specifications, conduct user tests on wireframe mock-ups; and to oversee the final online deployment.
experiences.subtitle: Jan 2010 - July 2011

profile.name: Karen Darby
profile.title: Senior Consultant / QA Manager
profile.bio: I have 15 years experience working in software development. My most recent roles have been as a Test Manager and QA Consultant.  I have worked on projects using traditional and agile software testing practices.  I am experienced in test automation, performance, load and reliability testing.
profile.passion:
I'm passionate about helping teams to deliver high quality software. 

Outside of work I'm a keen sea kayaker, skier and bushwalker.

experiences.description:
I have had roles throughout the software development life cycle from design, to implementation, testing and support. My career began as programmer working on security products. My work evolved with roles as Technical Customer Support, Release Manager and Test Manager. I have worked in a broad range of industries including security, telecommunications, retail and defence.

I'm excited about how good agile development practices give an emphasis to processes that assist in building quality software.  Consideration of quality becomes part of every day software development rather than a task left to the test team. Practices like TDD, BDD and even just co-location of test resources with the developers helps deliver better software to our customers.

My role on this project was as Test Consultant. I set up testing frameworks for the company and  developed the test strategy for the Rise project. In addition I was involved in the establishment of the automated acceptance testing process using Cucumber.
experiences.subtitle: Rise 2014

experiences.description: At Macquarie I worked as Business Analyst and QA consultant. I was involved in the analysis of business requirements and development of user stories. I performed load testing of the application and assisted in usability testing.
experiences.subtitle: Mortice 05 2013 - 2014

experiences.description: I was the primary tester on this project. I developed the test strategy, automated acceptance tests using Cucumber, built and ran load tests using Jmeter as well as performing exploratory testing of the application to confirm that it was fit for release.
experiences.subtitle: Elms 2012 - 2013

experiences.description: I was Test Manager on the project leading a team of 7 external testers and managing the internal ATO test team.  In addition I was responsible for the Test Strategy, Test Plan and Test reports. This was a complex project with many stakeholders that was  delivered on time with no significant issues found.
experiences.subtitle: Standard Business Reporting 2009 - 2010

profile.name: Tom Wall
profile.title: Visual Designer
profile.bio: Designer of things - worked internationally for advertising and digital agencies - on projects big and small. Ranging from nightclub branding, mobile customer self-service applications, retail e-commerce to international charities - his work has been on billboards, used daily by customers and even tattooed on skin.
profile.passion:
I love that design transforms - creating a spark from base ingredients and bringing things to life. When that spark is at the point where technology, the customer and design meet - that's exciting.

When I'm not working I can usually be found doing one of a few different things - fixing my motorcyle, riding said motorcycle, designing and screenprinting tshirts, taking photos or cooking with wild abandon.

experiences.description:
Over 15 years of experience working in a variety of design fields - from advertising and publishing to concentrating on digital design and bringing my experience together in a new medium. 

My approach has always been to think about the 'why' as well as 'what it looks like' and 'how it works'. Every problem needs an appropriate response -  and I've worked hard throughout my career to always make sure things are great to use as well as great to look at.
UX, interface and visual design on small Agile team working on quick to market apps and new product development.
experiences.subtitle: March 2014 – Present Melbourne, Australia

experiences.description: Lead visual designer for a revamped Vodafone customer service responsive webapp project. The redesign was a key touchpoint in reviving their connection with millions of customers, replacing legacy applications and rolling out a new brand, with a new attitude.
experiences.subtitle: April 2013 – January 2014 Sydney, Australia

experiences.description: UX design of web-based B2B software products. Working to quickly revamp and re-imagine web-apps in an Agile environment - more iterations than you can count.
Digital campaign work with Grey Healthcare Sydney
experiences.subtitle: December 2007 - February 2008

experiences.description: Campaign work for Bausch & Lomb UK for Pure Vision Contact Lens range - microsites and print advertising while working at 23RED agency in London.
experiences.subtitle: December 2006 - 2007  London, UK

profile.name: Pete Cohen
profile.title: Business Analyst
profile.bio: Understanding the systems and structures customers must work within is extremely important to DiUS. As such, I’ve always valued the ‘soft skills’ we provide that help bridge the gap between business and technology teams. I use my tertiary qualifications and expertise in psychology to help these teams collaborate to maximise the value of projects. In addition, I apply the Build-Measure-Learn process to each project I complete to ensure I’m always improving the way I provide services to customers.
profile.passion:
Helping business and technology people understand each other so our projects can provide the best possible value to our clients is extremely important to me.

Before starting my technology career, I was a professional musician and spent a decade touring with my band Sodastream. I’ve not lost the music bug – I still moonlight on weekends as a double bass player.

experiences.description:
I’m an experienced business analyst who has worked with customers across several industries to deliver bespoke web-based and mobile software applications. I’ve helped stakeholders at all levels of companies to define business value for projects, made recommendations to senior executives to improve the relevance of particular businesses and assumed responsibility for project delivery. I’m particularly aware of the need to mitigate risk as projects transition into the delivery phase.

Outside direct project work, I’m Chair of the Steering Committee for Random Hacks of Kindness (RHoK) – of which DiUS is a regional partner and strong supporter. Google, Microsoft, Yahoo! and the World Bank founded RHoK to create a community of volunteers to build applications to support humanitarian aid and disaster relief. I’ve led a volunteer RHoK team to design, build, open-source and make available a fire information website for the Warrandyte Community Association.

In addition, I’m passionate about Creating Shared Value – which combines creating value for companies with adding value to the broader society. In other words, everyone wins rather than one sector making gains at someone else’s expense.

I’m also heavily involved in the technology community and have spoken twice at the Agile Australia conference – a leading event for the Agile development community in this country. In addition, I’ve presented at the Business Analysts’ World Conference in 2012 and the LAST (Lean, Agile, Systems Thinking) Conference 2013.

Through my Masters studies I have had the opportunity to explore a variety of aspects of IT management and governance. The most recent subject I undertook was in eHealth and Bioinformatics, and included a technical research assignment on Medications Management Systems.

GE Capital had piloted agile development practices with a view to rolling this methodology further across the digital team. I compared the pilot against industry best practices, assessed the pilot’s governance standards and made recommendations about how GE Capital should proceed.
experiences.subtitle: Agile Review

experiences.description: Real estate website Onthehouse.com.au wanted to increase customer engagement by redesigning the service it provided. I worked with senior executives to define the company’s value proposition and develop a more compelling consumer offering. My role included aligning the interests of stakeholders such as the chief executive officer, the technology team, the legal team and the product team, providing agile coaching for the business units, undertaking transition planning and coordinating a technical proof of concept.
experiences.subtitle: Website Redevelopment

experiences.description: After several prior failed attempts, Australia Post recently launched their Digital Mailbox product. It enables service providers and end customers to embrace a digital document workflow. Security and privacy considerations were paramount, and my role involved ensuring that the mobile delivery team were efficient in bringing this new product to market, while balancing the heavy governance requirements of Australia Post.
experiences.subtitle: Australia Post Digital Mailbox

educations.description: Certificate IV in Small Business Administration

education_and_trainings.description: Certificate IV in Small Business Administration

profile.name: Mike Farah
profile.title: Senior Software Engineer
profile.bio: I'm a passionate and enthusiastic software engineer; skilled in a variety of processes and technologies. I enjoy using Agile processes and I am well known by my peers for my analytical, design, technical and leadership skills.
profile.passion:
Building great software - that is software that people enjoy using and maintaining! To that end - I try to ensure that the solution is kept as simple and focussed as possible.

Also I like cats.

experiences.description: This is a green-fields project, it entails creating a new RESTful locations service based on an event-sourcing style architecture. This will form part of the backbone for many other applications. We are also creating a separate angular UI front end as one of the first clients of the service. My role as a senior software engineer is to help develop, architect the project.
experiences.subtitle: Locations

experiences.description: The MyFun project was about creating a streamlined experience for Chinese investors looking to purchase property in Australia. I worked as a ruby on rails developer, as part of an international team, to create an end point for the new website to retrieve up-to-date listings and and we developed an administration UI in backbone to allow real estate agents to manage their listings in China.
experiences.subtitle: MyFun

experiences.description: Yellow Pages is the flagship product of Sensis, it receives over 10 million visits per month. This project was conceived to unify Yellow Pages from a separate mobile and desktop site into a single sophisticated responsive web application using the latest tools and technologies. My role as a senior software engineer included mentoring junior developers, participating in UI sketch sessions and pushing responsive web design to the limits.
experiences.subtitle: Yellow Pages - Platform Evolution

experiences.description: AGL Solar use an in-house Rails web application to manage their core business workflow, that is, selling and installing solar power systems. My role at AGL Solar consisted of two main parts: enhancing the core application to improve company productivity and increase application scalability and performance; and creating a new self-service application that allows potential customers to quickly create quotes online. I also performed business analysis duties - which involved things like writing BDD tests with business stakeholders.

Pro Medicus is an Australian based, leading provider of Radiology Information Systems (RIS), with clients across the globe. Coral is a state of the art RIS designed to replace their existing legacy product. It has a REST driven Java back-end and a Adobe Flex front-end. Coral provides integration points with other medical software via HL7 and integrates directly with Medicare for billing. My role in developing Coral was a technical lead, with focus on design and architecture of the Adobe Flex client as well as the HL7 and Medicare integration points.
experiences.subtitle: Coral

educations.description: B. of Software Engineering, 1st Class Hons

education_and_trainings.description: B. of Software Engineering, 1st Class Hons

profile.name: Tarcio Saraiva
profile.title: Software Engineer
profile.bio:
Collaborative. Passionate. Experienced. Love a laugh and I never lose the smile.

With more than 10 years of experience applied in both commercial, corporate and open source projects I'm the kind of professional that loves a challenge and thrives on being part of a collaborative team where everyone is both a teacher and a student. 

Inquisitive by nature and with a great eye for detail I'm always focusing on quality and experimenting with new technologies.
profile.passion:
Work wise I love the new: green field solutions usually get me very excited as it brings the possibility of exploring and learning new tech.

Part of that involves collaborating in events such as Random Hacks of Kidness (RHoK) and giving back to the community - either by serving soup or helping a community garden.

Outside of work I have many interests which I try to dedicate an equal amount of time to them. Among them are cycling, Aquascaping, origami, cooking and coffee - I roast my own beans.

experiences.description:
Implementation of security modules into Aconex SaaS product for managing building and construction projects.

Heavily involved in Multifactor Authentication and Single Sign On - as well as Cross-site Scripting on a minor scale - we delivered a solution that enhanced the security of Aconex platform but also heavily improved the code base by refactoring legacy code thus decoupling the authentication module for better testing.

One of the key achievements was the implementation of the Single Sign On and Multifactor Authentication in the Aconex iOS app. Leveraging from Aconex software of choice to manage Single Sign On connections we were able to reduce changes in the iOS app by issuing OpenID Connect Tokens while making the users authenticate against their own Identity Provider.

Other achievements included introducing functional tests in RSpec, building a pipeline to test and publish the iOS app and migration of the mobile code base from Subversion in India to Aconex's own, Melbourne-based Git servers.
experiences.subtitle: Advanced Compliance Module

experiences.description:
Delivery of an iOS application (APDM) for both iPad and iPhone that allows you to receive and pay bills as well as store important documents.

APDM made use of an internal API (Façade, not the design pattern) that was being developed in parallel with the back-end system to minify our iOS development efforts. The Façade, written in Grails, was created to provide APDM better endpoints than the back-end system thus simplifying the communication and reducing bandwidth consumption from the apps.

A key achievement was to develop a suite of "acceptance tests". These were executed against every new release of the third party server-side application, which gave the organisation confidence that there had been no regressions that originated from that release. This in turn minimised time lost attempting to diagnose defects that were not originating from the iOS application we were developing.

Another important achievement was the simplification of the Multifactor Authentication process. By masking some of the steps in the Façade we were able to reduce complexity on APDM and test the feature by applying mocking mechanisms.
experiences.subtitle: Digital Mailbox

experiences.description:
Member of the team that was working on a number of initiatives to improve Open Universities Australia website.

My key achievement was the implementation of the Careers section, a browse-able and searchable feature that would allow students and professionals alike to map their career paths to OUA courses.

Part of this delivery was the implementation of a migration tool. This tool would read information from structured Word documents and generate an XML file that could be imported into the database.
experiences.subtitle: OUA website

experiences.description:
GMP is financial tool that allows businesses around to world to execute monetary transactions online.

Composed of many modules and security features - most tightly integrated to the bank's security architecture - my involvement were usually related to end-to-end development, from JavaScript to Spring Framework I was responsible for developing new features or refactor code.

As part of my involvement I also assisted in getting the Agile wall up to speed ensuring team members could have visibility of the project.
experiences.subtitle: Global Markets Platform (GMP)

experiences.description:
Working with an UX professional and a visual designer I completed the team by providing my front-end development skills to be applied to the new Deakin Worldly Website.

The key achievement in this project was the creation of a fully responsive website with a long, hierarchical menu that would collapse and provide a great experience for the end user without disrupting the user's attention.
experiences.subtitle: Deakin Wordly Website
